alert.note: Alert for Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 12:44PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Henry County in southeastern Alabama, Clay, southwestern Randolph, southwestern Calhoun and northwestern Early Counties in southwestern Georgia through 215 PM EDT/115 PM CDT/... At 143 PM EDT/1243 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Abbeville, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Blakely, Bellville, Haleburg, Bluffton, Shorterville, Walter F. George Lock And Dam, Walter F George Lake, Parksville, Hayes, Pecan, Jones Crossing, Bethel, Suttons Corner, Cotton Hill, Fort Gaines-Clay Airport, Balkum, Harrisons Mill and Barnes. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT/900 PM CDT/ for southwestern Georgia.
